description: Controls the input level to the current primitive. Affects headroom and distortion characteristics.
notes: Maps logarithmically from -20dB to +20dB. Used to adjust input before processing.

description: Controls the output level from the current primitive. Used for level matching after processing.
notes: Maps logarithmically from -20dB to +20dB.

description: Blends dry and wet signal. Controls the prominence of the effect.
notes: 0.0 = dry only, 1.0 = wet only.

description: Bypasses the entire primitive. Signal passes through unprocessed.
notes: 0.0 = active, 1.0 = bypassed.

description: Selects which character engine is active: 0=K-Style Overdrive, 1=Rodent Distortion, 2=Fuzz Face, 3=Muff Fuzz, 4=VCA Compressor, 5=Optical Compressor, 6=BitCrusher.
notes: Global parameter that determines which character engine processes the signal.

description: Amount of saturation and harmonic distortion added by the overdrive engine.
notes: 0.0 = no drive, 1.0 = full saturation. Shared by K-Style Overdrive, Rodent Distortion, Fuzz Face, and Muff Fuzz engines.

description: Adjusts the tonal balance between bass and treble in the overdrive circuit.
notes: 0.0 = brighter tone, 1.0 = warmer/more mid-heavy tone. Only applies to K-Style Overdrive.

description: Adjusts the signature Klon-style midrange hump characteristic.
notes: 0.0 = flat response, 1.0 = full Klon-style mid boost.

description: Adjusts the bias point of the fuzz circuit, affecting symmetry and warmth.
notes: Lower values create more asymmetrical distortion, higher values produce cleaner tones.

description: Controls the stability of the fuzz circuit, reducing sputtering and noise.
notes: Higher values increase circuit stability at the expense of dynamic responsiveness.

description: Bypasses the tone stack in the Muff Fuzz engine when set to 1.0.
notes: 0.0 = tone stack active, 1.0 = bypassed.

description: Sets the compression threshold in decibels. Lower values trigger compression at lower signal levels.
notes: Shared by VCA and Optical Compressor engines. Maps to -60dB to 0dB range.

description: Compression ratio. Higher values provide more aggressive compression.
notes: Shared by VCA and Optical Compressor engines. Maps to 1:1 to 20:1.

description: Attack time in milliseconds. Faster attacks reduce transients more aggressively.
notes: Shared by VCA and Optical Compressor engines. Maps to 1ms to 1000ms.

description: Release time in milliseconds. Faster releases provide more pumping effect.
notes: Shared by VCA and Optical Compressor engines. Maps to 10ms to 1000ms.

description: Controls the compression knee characteristic. Higher values provide softer, more musical compression.
notes: Shared by VCA and Optical Compressor engines. 0.0 = hard knee, 1.0 = soft knee.

description: Selects the optical compressor mode. Different modes emulate various optical cell responses.
notes: Optical Compressor engine only. Emulates different optical cell behaviors.

description: Controls the sample rate reduction amount. Lower values create more aliasing and digital artifacts.
notes: BitCrusher engine only. 0.0 = maximum reduction, 1.0 = no reduction.

description: Controls the bit depth of the BitCrusher. Lower values create more quantization distortion.
notes: BitCrusher engine only. 0.0 = 1-bit, 1.0 = full resolution.

description: Controls the amount of aliasing. Inverse of the old filter parameter.
notes: BitCrusher engine only. 0.0 = no aliasing (full filtering), 1.0 = full aliasing (no filtering).

description: Blends between original and BitCrushed signal.
notes: BitCrusher engine only. 0.0 = no effect, 1.0 = full BitCrush.

description: Adds random timing variations to the sample rate reduction for a more organic digital distortion.
notes: BitCrusher engine only.

description: Adds DC offset to the signal, creating asymmetric distortion and harmonic coloration.
notes: BitCrusher engine only. 0.5 = no offset, 0.0 = negative offset, 1.0 = positive offset.

description: Sets the threshold below which the signal is gated to silence, reducing noise.
notes: BitCrusher engine only.

description: Adds TPDF dithering noise with noise shaping to reduce quantization artifacts.
notes: BitCrusher engine only.

description: Selects which echo engine is active: 0=Tape Echo, 1=Digital Delay, 2=Modulated Delay.
notes: Global parameter that determines which echo engine processes the signal.

description: Controls the input level to the echo engine in decibels. Affects saturation and headroom.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Controls the output level from the echo engine in decibels. Used for level matching.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Blends between dry (0.0) and wet (1.0) signal. Controls the prominence of the echo effect.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = fully dry, 1.0 = fully wet.

description: Bypasses the entire echo primitive when set to 1.0. Signal passes through unprocessed.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = active, 1.0 = bypassed.

description: Sets the delay time in milliseconds. Mapped logarithmically where 0.0 is shortest and 1.0 is longest.
notes: Shared by all echo engines. Typical range 1ms to 2000ms.

description: Controls the amount of delayed signal fed back into the delay line. Higher values create more repeats.
notes: Shared by all echo engines. Values near 1.0 approach self-oscillation.

description: Controls the stereo spread of the echo effect. Higher values create wider stereo imaging.
notes: Shared by all echo engines. 0.0 = mono, 1.0 = maximum width.

description: Enables tempo synchronization for the echo effect.
notes: Shared by all echo engines. 0.0 = free running, 1.0 = tempo sync.

description: Sets the note division for tempo-synchronized delays.
notes: Shared by all echo engines. Maps to different note divisions.

description: Enables ping-pong delay mode for stereo bouncing echoes.
notes: Shared by all echo engines. 0.0 = standard delay, 1.0 = ping-pong.

description: Simulates tape aging characteristics in the Tape Echo engine.
notes: Tape Echo engine only. 0.0 = new tape, 1.0 = old tape.

description: Controls wow and flutter amount in the Tape Echo engine.
notes: Tape Echo engine only. 0.0 = no flutter, 1.0 = maximum flutter.

description: Controls tape saturation amount in the Tape Echo engine.
notes: Tape Echo engine only. 0.0 = clean, 1.0 = saturated.

description: Simulates BBD clock noise in analog delay emulation.
notes: Digital Delay engine only. 0.0 = no noise, 1.0 = maximum noise.

description: Simulates BBD companding artifacts in analog delay emulation.
notes: Digital Delay engine only. 0.0 = no companding, 1.0 = full companding.

description: Controls the filter cutoff frequency in the echo feedback path.
notes: Shared by all echo engines. Maps logarithmically from 20Hz to 20kHz.

description: Controls the filter resonance in the echo feedback path.
notes: Shared by all echo engines. 0.0 = no resonance, 1.0 = self-oscillation.

description: Controls the modulation rate in Hertz. Determines how fast the LFO moves.
notes: Modulated Delay engine only. Maps logarithmically from 0.1Hz to 20Hz.

description: Controls the depth of delay time modulation. Higher values create more pronounced pitch shifting.
notes: Modulated Delay engine only. 0.0 = no modulation, 1.0 = maximum depth.

description: Selects which ambience engine is active: 0=Spring Reverb, 1=Plate Reverb, 2=Hall Reverb, 3=Shimmer Reverb.
notes: Global parameter that determines which ambience engine processes the signal.

description: Controls the input level to the ambience engine in decibels. Affects reverb intensity.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Controls the output level from the ambience engine in decibels. Used for level matching.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Blends between dry (0.0) and wet (1.0) signal. Controls the prominence of the reverb effect.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = fully dry, 1.0 = fully wet.

description: Bypasses the entire ambience primitive when set to 1.0. Signal passes through unprocessed.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = active, 1.0 = bypassed.

description: Controls the reverb decay time in seconds. Longer values create more spacious sounds.
notes: Shared by Hall and Shimmer Reverb engines. Maps logarithmically from 0.1 seconds to 10 seconds.

description: Controls the pre-delay time in milliseconds. Adds space between direct sound and reverb.
notes: Shared by all reverb engines. Maps logarithmically from 1ms to 100ms.

description: Controls high-frequency damping in the reverb tail. Higher values create darker reverbs.
notes: Shared by all reverb engines. 0.0 = no damping, 1.0 = full damping.

description: Controls the physical size of the simulated room or space.
notes: Shared by all reverb engines. 0.0 = small room, 1.0 = large hall.

description: Controls the drip-like behavior of spring reverb. Simulates mechanical resonance.
notes: Spring Reverb engine only. 0.0 = minimal drip, 1.0 = maximum drip.

description: Controls the number of virtual springs in the Spring Reverb simulation.
notes: Spring Reverb engine only. 0.0 = one spring, 1.0 = multiple springs.

description: Controls the tension of the springs in the Spring Reverb simulation.
notes: Spring Reverb engine only. 0.0 = loose, 1.0 = tight.

description: Controls the mix of pitch-shifted harmonics in the Shimmer Reverb.
notes: Shimmer Reverb engine only. 0.0 = no shimmer, 1.0 = full shimmer.

description: Controls the interval between base and shimmer frequencies. Higher values create wider harmonics.
notes: Shimmer Reverb engine only. 0.0 = octave up, 1.0 = fifth up.

description: Freezes the reverb tail, creating infinite sustain.
notes: Shared by all reverb engines. 0.0 = normal decay, 1.0 = freeze.

description: Controls the diffusion of the reverb tail. Higher values create denser tails.
notes: Shared by all reverb engines. 0.0 = sparse, 1.0 = dense.

description: Controls the amount of modulation applied to the reverb tail.
notes: Shared by all reverb engines. 0.0 = no modulation, 1.0 = full modulation.

description: Controls the stereo spread of the reverb effect.
notes: Shared by all reverb engines. 0.0 = mono, 1.0 = wide stereo.

description: Selects which sculptor engine is active: 0=State Variable Filter, 1=Ladder Filter, 2=Formant Filter.
notes: Global parameter that determines which sculptor engine processes the signal.

description: Controls the input level to the sculptor engine in decibels. Affects filtering headroom.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Controls the output level from the sculptor engine in decibels. Used for level matching.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Blends between dry (0.0) and wet (1.0) signal. Allows parallel filtering effects.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = fully dry, 1.0 = fully wet.

description: Bypasses the entire sculptor primitive when set to 1.0. Signal passes through unprocessed.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = active, 1.0 = bypassed.

description: Sets the cutoff frequency for the filter in Hertz.
notes: Shared by State Variable and Ladder Filters. Maps logarithmically from 20Hz to 20kHz.

description: Controls filter resonance or Q factor. Higher values create more pronounced filtering effects.
notes: Shared by State Variable, Ladder, and Formant Filter engines. 0.0 = no resonance, 1.0 = self-oscillation.

description: Selects the filter type: 0=Lowpass, 1=Highpass, 2=Bandpass, 3=Notch.
notes: State Variable Filter engine only. Selects filter mode.

description: Controls the mix of the lowpass component in the State Variable Filter.
notes: State Variable Filter engine only. 0.0 = no LPF, 1.0 = full LPF.

description: Controls the mix of the bandpass component in the State Variable Filter.
notes: State Variable Filter engine only. 0.0 = no BPF, 1.0 = full BPF.

description: Controls the mix of the highpass component in the State Variable Filter.
notes: State Variable Filter engine only. 0.0 = no HPF, 1.0 = full HPF.

description: Controls the mix of the notch component in the State Variable Filter.
notes: State Variable Filter engine only. 0.0 = no Notch, 1.0 = full Notch.

description: Controls the saturation and distortion level in the Ladder Filter.
notes: Ladder Filter engine only. 0.0 = clean, 1.0 = saturated.

description: Controls gain compensation in the Ladder Filter to maintain consistent levels at high resonance.
notes: Ladder Filter engine only. 0.0 = no compensation, 1.0 = full compensation.

description: Selects the vowel sound for the Formant Filter. Maps to different vowel formant frequencies.
notes: Formant Filter engine only. Morphs between A, E, I, O, U vowel sounds.

description: Controls morphing between vowel sounds in the Formant Filter. Creates vocal-like sweeps.
notes: Formant Filter engine only. 0.0 = static vowel, 1.0 = continuous morphing.

description: Sets the fundamental frequency of the Comb Filter. Determines the harmonic spacing.
notes: Comb Filter engine only. Maps logarithmically from 20Hz to 20kHz.

description: Controls the feedback amount in the Comb Filter. Higher values create denser harmonics.
notes: Comb Filter engine only. 0.0 = no feedback, 1.0 = maximum feedback.

description: Inverts the polarity of the Comb Filter's feedback signal.
notes: Comb Filter engine only. 0.0 = positive feedback, 1.0 = inverted feedback.

description: Controls the bandwidth of the EQ section. Wider bandwidth affects more frequencies.
notes: EQ Section engine only. 0.0 = narrow, 1.0 = wide.

description: Morphs between different vowel formant shapes (A, E, I, O, U).
notes: FormantFilter engine only.

description: Selects which harmonizer engine is active: 0=Doubler, 1=Polyphonic Harmonizer, 2=Glitch Octave.
notes: Global parameter that determines which harmonizer engine processes the signal.

description: Controls the input level to the harmonizer engine in decibels. Affects saturation and headroom.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Controls the output level from the harmonizer engine in decibels. Used for level matching.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Blends between dry (0.0) and wet (1.0) signal. Controls the prominence of the harmonizer effect.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = fully dry, 1.0 = fully wet.

description: Bypasses the entire harmonizer primitive when set to 1.0. Signal passes through unprocessed.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = active, 1.0 = bypassed.

description: Delay applied to the doubler effect. Creates subtle timing differences for natural width.
notes: Doubler engine only. Maps linearly from 0ms to 100ms.

description: Modulation rate for the doubler effect. Affects stereo width and variation.
notes: Doubler engine only. Maps logarithmically from 0.1Hz to 20Hz.

description: Controls the stereo spread of the doubler effect.
notes: Doubler engine only. 0.0 = mono, 1.0 = maximum width.

description: First interval for the polyphonic harmonizer. Sets the first harmony note.
notes: Polyphonic Harmonizer engine only. Maps to different intervals (e.g., major third, perfect fifth).

description: Second interval for the polyphonic harmonizer. Sets the second harmony note.
notes: Polyphonic Harmonizer engine only. Maps to different intervals (e.g., minor seventh, major sixth).

description: Preserves formants during pitch shifting. Helps retain vocal character.
notes: Polyphonic Harmonizer engine only. 0.0 = no preservation, 1.0 = full preservation.

description: Controls pitch tracking smoothing time in milliseconds. Affects tracking responsiveness vs stability.
notes: Polyphonic Harmonizer engine only. Maps from 1ms to 100ms.

description: Controls the octave direction for the Glitch Octave effect. 0.0 = down, 0.5 = both, 1.0 = up.
notes: Glitch Octave engine only. Determines octave shift direction.

description: Controls the intensity of the glitch effect. Higher values create more pronounced glitches.
notes: Glitch Octave engine only. 0.0 = no glitch, 1.0 = full glitch.

description: Controls the stutter rate in Hertz. Determines how often the glitch repeats.
notes: Glitch Octave engine only. Maps logarithmically from 0.1Hz to 20Hz.

description: Applies bitcrushing to the glitched signal. Creates digital artifacts.
notes: Glitch Octave engine only. 0.0 = no bitcrush, 1.0 = full bitcrush.

description: Probability of freezing the glitched signal. Creates random pauses.
notes: Glitch Octave engine only. 0.0 = never freeze, 1.0 = always freeze.

description: Probability of reversing the glitched signal. Creates backward playback effects.
notes: Glitch Octave engine only. 0.0 = never reverse, 1.0 = always reverse.

description: Controls time stretching factor without affecting pitch. Allows extreme slow-down or speed-up.
notes: PhasedVocoder engine only. 0.0 = 25% speed, 0.5 = normal speed, 1.0 = 400% speed.

description: Controls pitch shifting in semitones while preserving timing.
notes: PhasedVocoder engine only. 0.0 = -12 semitones, 0.5 = no shift, 1.0 = +12 semitones.

description: Smears spectral bins across frequencies for ethereal, reverb-like effects.
notes: PhasedVocoder engine only.

description: Preserves transient attacks while processing steady-state portions.
notes: PhasedVocoder engine only.

description: Resets phase relationships for robotic vocoder effects.
notes: PhasedVocoder engine only.

description: Gates spectral bins below threshold for noise reduction or creative effects.
notes: PhasedVocoder engine only.

description: Blends between dry and processed signal.
notes: PhasedVocoder engine only.

description: Freezes spectral content for infinite sustain effects.
notes: PhasedVocoder engine only.

description: Controls transient detection attack time in milliseconds.
notes: PhasedVocoder engine only. 0.0 = 0.1ms, 1.0 = 10ms.

description: Controls transient detection release time in milliseconds.
notes: PhasedVocoder engine only. 0.0 = 1ms, 1.0 = 100ms.

description: Frequency shift amount in Hz. Center is no shift, left is down, right is up.
notes: FrequencyShifter engine only. 0.0 = -1000Hz, 0.5 = 0Hz, 1.0 = +1000Hz.

description: Feedback amount for resonant and evolving textures.
notes: FrequencyShifter engine only. Can create metallic resonances at high values.

description: Blend between dry and frequency-shifted signal.
notes: FrequencyShifter engine only. 0.0 = dry, 1.0 = wet.

description: Stereo spread by offsetting shift amount between channels.
notes: FrequencyShifter engine only. Creates wide stereo effects.

description: Resonant filter at the shift frequency for bell-like tones.
notes: FrequencyShifter engine only. Adds harmonic emphasis.

description: Modulation depth for animated frequency shifting.
notes: FrequencyShifter engine only. Creates chorus and vibrato effects.

description: Modulation rate in Hz for frequency shift animation.
notes: FrequencyShifter engine only. 0.0 = 0Hz, 1.0 = 10Hz.

description: Output mode: lower sideband, upper sideband, or ring modulation.
notes: FrequencyShifter engine only. 0.0 = lower, 0.5 = ring mod, 1.0 = upper.

description: Selects which movement engine is active: 0=Tremolo, 1=Rotary Speaker, 2=Harmonic Tremolo.
notes: Global parameter that determines which movement engine processes the signal.

description: Controls the input level to the movement engine in decibels. Affects modulation depth.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Controls the output level from the movement engine in decibels. Used for level matching.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Blends between dry (0.0) and wet (1.0) signal. Controls the prominence of the movement effect.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = fully dry, 1.0 = fully wet.

description: Bypasses the entire movement primitive when set to 1.0. Signal passes through unprocessed.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = active, 1.0 = bypassed.

description: Modulation rate in Hertz. Controls how fast the LFO moves.
notes: Shared by all movement engines. Maps logarithmically from 0.1Hz to 20Hz.

description: Modulation depth. Higher values create more pronounced amplitude variation.
notes: Shared by all movement engines. 0.0 = no modulation, 1.0 = maximum depth.

description: Enables tempo-synchronized modulation. Rate is tied to host DAW tempo.
notes: Shared by all movement engines. 0.0 = free running, 1.0 = tempo sync.

description: Note division for tempo-synchronized modulation. Sets how many notes per beat.
notes: Shared by all movement engines. 0.0 = whole note, 1.0 = sixteenth note.

description: Selects the waveform shape for the tremolo LFO. Options include sine, triangle, square, etc.
notes: Tremolo engine only. Selects waveform type.

description: Controls the stereo spread of the movement effect.
notes: Shared by all movement engines. 0.0 = mono, 1.0 = wide stereo.

description: Crossover frequency for harmonic tremolo. Separates low and high frequencies for independent modulation.
notes: Harmonic Tremolo engine only. Maps logarithmically from 20Hz to 20kHz.

description: Switches between slow and fast speed settings for the rotary speaker simulation.
notes: Rotary Speaker engine only. 0.0 = slow speed, 1.0 = fast speed.

description: Controls the acceleration of the rotary motor. Higher values simulate faster startup.
notes: Rotary Speaker engine only. 0.0 = instant start, 1.0 = gradual start.

description: Balances the horn and drum elements in the rotary speaker simulation.
notes: Rotary Speaker engine only. 0.0 = all horn, 1.0 = all drum.

description: Selects which sampler engine is active: 0=Continuum, 1=Rhythmicon, 2=Acoustic Resonator.
notes: Global parameter that determines which sampler engine processes the signal.

description: Controls the input level to the sampler engine in decibels. Affects recording and processing levels.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Controls the output level from the sampler engine in decibels. Used for level matching.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Blends between dry (0.0) and wet (1.0) signal. Controls the prominence of the sampler effect.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = fully dry, 1.0 = fully wet.

description: Bypasses the entire sampler primitive when set to 1.0. Signal passes through unprocessed.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = active, 1.0 = bypassed.

description: Toggles recording mode when set to 1.0. Captures input audio into the sampler buffer.
notes: Shared by all sampler engines. 0.0 = playback mode, 1.0 = recording mode.

description: Toggles playback mode when set to 1.0. Plays back recorded audio from the sampler buffer.
notes: Shared by all sampler engines. 0.0 = stopped, 1.0 = playing.

description: Clears the sampler buffer when set to 1.0. Resets the recorded audio.
notes: Shared by all sampler engines. 0.0 = no clear, 1.0 = clear buffer.

description: Controls the playback speed/pitch of the Continuum engine. Higher values increase speed and pitch.
notes: Continuum Engine only. 0.0 = original speed, 1.0 = double speed.

description: Adds tape-like degradation to the Continuum engine. Simulates aging analog media.
notes: Continuum Engine only. 0.0 = new tape, 1.0 = old tape.

description: Simulates wow and flutter in the Continuum engine. Adds mechanical imperfections.
notes: Continuum Engine only. 0.0 = no wow/flutter, 1.0 = maximum wow/flutter.

description: Size of grains used in granular synthesis. Smaller grains produce glitchier textures.
notes: Continuum Engine only. Maps linearly from 1ms to 100ms.

description: Controls grain density in the Continuum engine. Affects the thickness of granular textures.
notes: Continuum Engine only. 0.0 = sparse, 1.0 = dense.

description: Controls the playback position within grains in the Continuum engine. Creates scrubbing effects.
notes: Continuum Engine only. 0.0 = beginning, 1.0 = end of buffer.

description: Controls the randomness of grain placement in the Continuum engine. Higher values create more chaotic textures.
notes: Continuum Engine only. 0.0 = deterministic, 1.0 = maximum spray.

description: Selects the scale for harmonic grain pitch shifting. Applies musical key constraints.
notes: Continuum Engine only. Selects major, minor, pentatonic, etc.

description: Controls the amount of harmonic pitch shifting applied to grains. Creates chord-like textures.
notes: Continuum Engine only. 0.0 = no harmonization, 1.0 = full harmonization.

description: Sets the buffer length in beats for the Rhythmicon engine. Determines loop duration.
notes: Rhythmicon Engine only. Maps to 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 beat lengths.

description: Controls the sensitivity of automatic slicing in the Rhythmicon engine. Affects beat detection.
notes: Rhythmicon Engine only. 0.0 = low sensitivity, 1.0 = high sensitivity.

description: Controls the evolution amount in the Rhythmicon engine. Creates generative variations.
notes: Rhythmicon Engine only. 0.0 = static loop, 1.0 = maximum evolution.

description: Selects the capture mode for the Acoustic Resonator engine. Determines how samples are captured.
notes: Acoustic Resonator Engine only. 0.0 = direct capture, 1.0 = resonant capture.

description: Selects the impulse response for the Acoustic Resonator engine. Determines the acoustic character.
notes: Acoustic Resonator Engine only. Selects from predefined IRs (e.g., room, hall, plate).

description: Controls the tension of the resonator in the Acoustic Resonator engine. Affects resonance behavior.
notes: Acoustic Resonator Engine only. 0.0 = loose, 1.0 = tight.

description: Controls the decay time of the resonator in the Acoustic Resonator engine.
notes: Acoustic Resonator Engine only. 0.0 = short decay, 1.0 = long decay.

description: Reverses the playback of the sampled audio. Useful for creative textural effects.
notes: All Sampler Engines. 0.0 = forward, 1.0 = reversed.

description: Selects which utility engine is active: 0=Channel Strip, 1=Mid-Side Processor, 2=Master Bus Limiter, 3=Harmonic Exciter, 4=Sidechain Compressor, 5=De-Reverberator, 6=Dynamic EQ, 7=Phase Aligner.
notes: Global parameter that determines which utility engine processes the signal.

description: Controls the input level to the utility engine in decibels. Affects processing headroom and character.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Controls the output level from the utility engine in decibels. Used for level matching.
notes: Global parameter. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Bypasses the entire utility primitive when set to 1.0. Signal passes through unprocessed.
notes: Global parameter. 0.0 = active, 1.0 = bypassed.

description: Sets the high-pass filter frequency in the Channel Strip. Removes low-frequency content.
notes: Channel Strip engine only. Maps logarithmically from 20Hz to 500Hz.

description: Sets the low-pass filter frequency in the Channel Strip. Removes high-frequency content.
notes: Channel Strip engine only. Maps logarithmically from 200Hz to 20kHz.

description: Controls the channel gain in the Channel Strip. Adjusts overall volume.
notes: Channel Strip engine only. Maps to -20dB to +20dB.

description: Controls the mid (center) channel gain in the Mid-Side Processor. Affects mono content.
notes: Mid-Side Processor engine only. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Controls the side (stereo) channel gain in the Mid-Side Processor. Affects stereo width.
notes: Mid-Side Processor engine only. Maps to -20dB to +20dB range.

description: Sets the high-pass filter frequency for the side channel in the Mid-Side Processor.
notes: Mid-Side Processor engine only. Maps logarithmically from 20Hz to 500Hz.

description: Sets the crossover frequency for the Mid-Side Bass Mono feature. Low frequencies go to mono.
notes: Mid-Side Processor engine only. Maps logarithmically from 20Hz to 200Hz.

description: Sets the threshold for the Master Bus Limiter. Controls when limiting occurs.
notes: Master Bus Limiter engine only. Maps to -60dB to 0dB range.

description: Sets the release time for the Master Bus Limiter. Controls how quickly the limiter recovers.
notes: Master Bus Limiter engine only. Maps from 10ms to 1000ms.

description: Controls lookahead time for the Master Bus Limiter. Improves transient handling.
notes: Master Bus Limiter engine only. Maps from 0ms to 100ms.

description: Controls the character of the Master Bus Limiter. Affects harmonic saturation and transparency.
notes: Master Bus Limiter engine only. 0.0 = transparent, 1.0 = colored.

description: Controls the excitation frequency in the Harmonic Exciter. Determines where harmonics are added.
notes: Harmonic Exciter engine only. Maps logarithmically from 100Hz to 10kHz.

description: Controls the drive amount in the Harmonic Exciter. Increases harmonic content.
notes: Harmonic Exciter engine only. 0.0 = no effect, 1.0 = full excitation.

description: Controls the mix of excited harmonics in the Harmonic Exciter. Blends original and processed signal.
notes: Harmonic Exciter engine only. 0.0 = no effect, 1.0 = full excitation.

description: Selects the harmonic content type in the Harmonic Exciter. Maps to different harmonic profiles.
notes: Harmonic Exciter engine only. Different harmonic generation algorithms.

description: Sets the threshold for the Sidechain Compressor. Controls when compression is triggered by sidechain.
notes: Sidechain Compressor engine only. Maps to -60dB to 0dB range.

description: Controls the compression ratio for the Sidechain Compressor. Higher values provide more aggressive pumping.
notes: Sidechain Compressor engine only. Maps to 1:1 to 20:1 ratio.

description: Sets the attack time for the Sidechain Compressor. Affects how quickly compression engages.
notes: Sidechain Compressor engine only. Maps to 0.1ms to 100ms range.

description: Sets the release time for the Sidechain Compressor. Controls how quickly compression disengages.
notes: Sidechain Compressor engine only. Maps to 10ms to 1000ms range.

description: Controls the knee characteristic of the Sidechain Compressor. Affects compression smoothness.
notes: Sidechain Compressor engine only. 0.0 = hard knee, 1.0 = soft knee.

description: Controls makeup gain for the Sidechain Compressor. Compensates for level reduction.
notes: Sidechain Compressor engine only. Maps to 0dB to +20dB range.

description: Controls the sensitivity of the De-Reverberator. Higher values remove more reverb.
notes: De-Reverberator engine only. 0.0 = no de-reverb, 1.0 = full de-reverb.

description: Controls the amount of reverb reduction in the De-Reverberator. Higher values remove more reverb.
notes: De-Reverberator engine only. Maps to 0dB to -20dB range.

description: kMix parameter for ConvolutionReverb engine.
notes: ConvolutionReverb engine only.

description: Controls the size of the reverb space in the platinum shimmer implementation.
notes: Platinum ShimmerReverb only. 0.0 = small room, 1.0 = large cathedral

description: Amount of pitch-shifted shimmer effect in the feedback path.
notes: Platinum ShimmerReverb only. 0.0 = no shimmer, 1.0 = maximum shimmer

description: Pitch shift amount for the shimmer effect in semitones.
notes: Platinum ShimmerReverb only. 0.0 = -12 semitones, 0.5 = no shift, 1.0 = +12 semitones

description: High frequency damping in the reverb tail.
notes: Platinum ShimmerReverb only. 0.0 = no damping, 1.0 = maximum damping

description: Diffusion amount controlling reverb density.
notes: Platinum ShimmerReverb only. 0.0 = minimal diffusion, 1.0 = maximum diffusion

description: Modulation depth for creating movement in the reverb.
notes: Platinum ShimmerReverb only. 0.0 = no modulation, 1.0 = maximum modulation

description: Pre-delay time before reverb onset.
notes: Platinum ShimmerReverb only. 0.0 = 0ms, 1.0 = 200ms

description: Stereo width of the reverb field.
notes: Platinum ShimmerReverb only. 0.0 = mono, 1.0 = wide stereo

description: Freeze the reverb buffer for infinite sustain.
notes: Platinum ShimmerReverb only. 0.0 = normal, 1.0 = frozen

description: Dry/wet mix control for the reverb effect.
notes: Platinum ShimmerReverb only. 0.0 = dry only, 1.0 = wet only

description: Amount of wavefolding distortion applied to the signal.
notes: 0.0 = no folding, 1.0 = maximum folding with multiple reflections

description: Asymmetric folding for even harmonic generation.
notes: 0.5 = symmetric, 0.0/1.0 = maximum asymmetry in different directions

description: DC offset before folding for asymmetric distortion.
notes: 0.5 = no offset, adds up to ±10% DC offset

description: Pre-folding gain to drive the wavefolder harder.
notes: Maps to 0.1x to 4.0x gain

description: Post-folding gain for output level control.
notes: Maps to 0.1x to 2.0x gain

description: Anti-derivative smoothing to reduce harsh artifacts.
notes: 0.0 = no smoothing, 1.0 = maximum smoothing

description: Harmonic emphasis on 2nd, 3rd, and 4th harmonics.
notes: 0.0 = no emphasis, 1.0 = maximum harmonic boost

description: Dry/wet mix control for parallel processing.
notes: 0.0 = dry signal only, 1.0 = wet signal only

description: First vowel selection for formant filtering (A, E, I, O, U).
Second vowel selection for morphing between formants.
Morphing amount between vowel 1 and vowel 2.
Resonance of the formant filters for sharper peaks.
notes: Scales Q factor from 0.5x to 2.5x of base values

description: High frequency shelf for brightness control.
notes: Controls shelf frequency from 2kHz to 8kHz

description: LFO modulation rate for animated vowel movement.
notes: 0.0 = no modulation, maps to 0-10Hz

description: Depth of LFO modulation for vowel morphing.
notes: 0.0 = no modulation, 1.0 = ±20% frequency shift

description: Dry/wet mix control for parallel processing.
notes: 0.0 = dry signal only, 1.0 = wet signal only

description: Controls the gain applied to transient portions of the signal
notes: TransientShaper_Platinum engine. Maps to 0.1-4.0x gain

description: Controls the gain applied to sustained portions of the signal
notes: TransientShaper_Platinum engine. Maps to 0.1-4.0x gain

description: Sets the attack time of the envelope detector
notes: TransientShaper_Platinum engine. Maps to 0.1-50ms

description: Sets the release time of the envelope detector
notes: TransientShaper_Platinum engine. Maps to 1-500ms

description: Controls the spectral separation between transients and sustain
notes: TransientShaper_Platinum engine. Adjusts HP/LP filter frequencies

description: Selects detection algorithm: Peak, RMS, Hilbert, or Hybrid
notes: TransientShaper_Platinum engine. 0-0.25=Peak, 0.25-0.5=RMS, 0.5-0.75=Hilbert, 0.75-1=Hybrid

description: Sets the lookahead time for improved transient detection
notes: TransientShaper_Platinum engine. Maps to 0-46ms

description: Controls the soft knee width for smoother dynamics
notes: TransientShaper_Platinum engine. Affects compression curve smoothness

description: Sets oversampling factor: 1x, 2x, or 4x
notes: TransientShaper_Platinum engine. 0-0.33=1x, 0.33-0.66=2x, 0.66-1=4x

description: Blends between dry and processed signal
notes: TransientShaper_Platinum engine. 0=dry, 1=wet
